net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.base.config

Class SearchIndexerDataLocationBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.base.config.SearchIndexerDataLocationBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SearchIndexerDataLocation, JaxbObject

    public class SearchIndexerDataLocationBean
extends Object
implements SearchIndexerDataLocation, JaxbObject
    This is the implementation of SearchIndexerDataLocation as JAXB-ready Java-Bean.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • getLocationUri

        public String getLocationUri()
        This method gets the location (typically an URL) with the data that should be part of the search index. This location will be indexed recursively according to the filter.
        • File-URLs should point to a directory to index (e.g. "file:///data/documents")
        • HTTP(S)-URLs should point to a web-site to index via a crawler.
        Specified by:
        getLocationUri in interface SearchIndexerDataLocation
        Returns:
        the URI to index.

      • setLocaltionUri

        public void setLocaltionUri(String path)
        Parameters:
        path - is the path to set

      • getSource

        public SearchIndexerSource getSource()
        This method gets the Source associated with this directory.
        Specified by:
        getSource in interface SearchIndexerDataLocation
        Returns:
        the SearchIndexerSource.

      • setSource

        public void setSource(SearchIndexerSourceBean source)
        Parameters:
        source - is the source to set

      • getEncoding

        public String getEncoding()
        This method gets the encoding of the resources in this location. If the encoding is specified (e.g. via content formats as XML or HTML) that specific encoding is used. - otherwise the default encoding returned by this method is used. Therefore you should typically not choose an UTF encoding.
        Specified by:
        getEncoding in interface SearchIndexerDataLocation
        Returns:
        the encoding used as fallback or null for automatic unicode detection.

      • setEncoding

        public void setEncoding(String encoding)
        Parameters:
        encoding - is the encoding to set

      • getBaseUri

        public String getBaseUri()
        This method gets the base-URI used to build the search-entry-URI for the location itself.
        This will typically be the empty string. However if you want to index multiple locations of the same source you can use this attribute. E.g. when source is "svn" and you have one location that points to where you checked out "trunk/documents" of a subversion repository then the base-URI may be "documents". Analog you may also have another location with a base-URI of "development/code". Therefore SearchSource.getUrlPrefix() may be something like "http://svn.foo.bar/trunk/".
        Specified by:
        getBaseUri in interface SearchIndexerDataLocation
        Returns:
        the base-URI for this location. If the base-URI is NOT empty, it should end with a slash ("/").

      • setBaseUri

        public void setBaseUri(String baseUri)
        Parameters:
        baseUri - is the baseUri to set

      • isAbsoluteUris

        public boolean isAbsoluteUris()
        This method determines if search-entry-URIs should be set to the absolute location. This can make sense if you want to index a web-site via an HTTP-location but also some related sites linked from there. In all other cases this should be false.
        Specified by:
        isAbsoluteUris in interface SearchIndexerDataLocation
        Returns:
        true if the absolute URIs should be stored in the search-index, false if the URIs should be relative to location with respect to the base-URI.
        See Also:
        SearchIndexerDataLocation.getBaseUri()

      • setAbsoluteUris

        public void setAbsoluteUris(boolean absoluteUris)
        Parameters:
        absoluteUris - is the absoluteUris to set

      • getFilter

        public FilterRuleChain<String> getFilter()
        Description copied from interface: SearchIndexerDataLocation
        This method gets the Filter that decides which resource-URIs should be accepted for indexing.
        ATTENTION:
        This filter is applied to files AND folders. If a folder is NOT accepted then this entire folder is NOT crawled any further and therefore its children are NOT indexed. All files that are crawled and accepted will be added to the search-index.
        Specified by:
        getFilter in interface SearchIndexerDataLocation
        Returns:
        the filter

      • setFilter

        public void setFilter(FilterRuleChain<String> filter)
        Parameters:
        filter - is the filter to set

      • getUriTransformer

        public StringTransformerChain getUriTransformer()
        This method gets the Transformer used to convert the (relative) URI of a resource to the indexed URI. By default the transformer will keep the URI untouched. However the Transformer can rewrite the URI if it differs from the path to access the file online. E.g. the relevant files in the data directory of a twiki/foswiki installation have the extension .txt while their URLs do NOT contain this extension.
        Specified by:
        getUriTransformer in interface SearchIndexerDataLocation
        Returns:
        the URI-Transformer.

      • setUriTransformer

        public void setUriTransformer(StringTransformerChain uriTransformer)
        Parameters:
        uriTransformer - is the uriTransformer to set

      • getUpdateStrategyVariant

        public String getUpdateStrategyVariant()
        This method determines the optional variant of the update-strategy.
        E.g. if the update-strategy of the according SearchIndexerSource is SearchIndexerSource.UPDATE_STRATEGY_VCS, then this variant can determine the actual VCS to use (see UPDATE_STRATEGY_VCS_VARIANT_* constants like SearchIndexerDataLocation.UPDATE_STRATEGY_VCS_VARIANT_SVN). However if not set ( null) the VCS will be auto detected (by looking for folders like .svn, .hg, .git, etc.)
        Specified by:
        getUpdateStrategyVariant in interface SearchIndexerDataLocation
        Returns:
        the variant for the update-strategy or null for default.

      • setUpdateStrategyVariant

        public void setUpdateStrategyVariant(String updateStrategyVariant)
        This method sets the update-strategy-variant.
        Parameters:
        updateStrategyVariant - is the new value to set.
